summary: This is a letter from the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York to defense counsel in the case against Ghislaine Maxwell, detailing a large production of discovery materials. The materials include financial records from multiple banks for Jeffrey Epstein, Ghislaine Maxwell, and related entities, as well as other documents and video files. The letter is governed by a protective order and provides instructions for accessing the electronic files.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The defendant in the criminal case referenced (United States v. Ghislaine Maxwell). Financial records for her and entities associated with her are being produced as part of discovery.

events.title: Protective Order Issued
events.description: A protective order was issued in the case, governing the confidentiality of discovery materials.

events.title: Defense Request for Files
events.description: The defense sent a letter specifying files they requested, which the government is now reproducing.

events.title: Discovery Production to Defense
events.description: The U.S. Attorney's Office produces a massive volume of discovery materials (financial records, documents, videos) to Ghislaine Maxwell's defense team.

locations: Silvio J. Mollo Building, One Saint Andrew's Plaza, New York, New York 10007
Cohen & Gresser LLP, 800 Third Avenue, New York, NY 10022
Haddon, Morgan and Foreman, P.C., 150 East Tenth Avenue, Denver, CO 80203
keyFacts: The U.S. Attorney's Office produced a vast amount of discovery material (over 150,000 pages based on Bates numbers) to Ghislaine Maxwell's defense team in October 2020.
The discovery includes extensive financial records from Deutsche Bank, JPMorgan Chase, Citibank, UBS, and American Express for Jeffrey Epstein, Ghislaine Maxwell, and related entities/trusts.
The related financial entities named include Angara Trust, Montepelier Trust, Terramar Project, Inc., Max Foundation, Ghislaine Maxwell IRA, and Ellmax, LLC.
The production also included non-financial items labeled 'GM Documents' and 'LSJ Scene2Go', as well as video files requiring specific software to view.
All materials are governed by a protective order dated July 31, 2020, designating much of the information as confidential.
